alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Camas Prairie; West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 2:39AM MST until December 21 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate snow, blowing snow, and dangerous wind chills likely. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches, except 5 to 10 inches over the mountains possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...West Central Mountains, Boise Mountains and Camas Prairie zones. * WHEN...From this evening through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and poor visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Snow plows will have difficulty keeping roads cleared due to drifting and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow will be tonight and winds will increase toward the end of the snow. This will keep snow blowing back onto roads for much of Wednesday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Boise Mountains; Camas Prairie; West Central Mountains
